content.title: Heart Failure Classification
content.statement: Heart failure is classified by left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF): HFrEF (LVEF ≤40%), HFmrEF (LVEF 41-49%), and HFpEF (LVEF ≥50%), with distinct pathophysiology and treatment approaches.

explanation.intuition: Heart failure is a clinical syndrome where the heart cannot pump blood effectively. EF-based classification guides treatment.
explanation.key_insight: GDMT for HFrEF includes the 'four pillars': ARNI/ACEi/ARB, beta-blocker, MRA, and SGLT2i - all reduce mortality.
explanation.technical_details: Stage A-D classification: A=at risk, B=structural disease without symptoms, C=symptomatic HF, D=advanced HF requiring specialized interventions.

citations.source: Heidenreich PA, et al. 2022 AHA/ACC/HFSA Guideline for HF Management. Circulation 2022;145:e895-e1032.
McDonagh TA, et al. 2021 ESC Guidelines for HF. Eur Heart J 2021;42:3599-3726.
